subject: Productivity
title: The Gig Economy
description: A 60-second lesson on The Gig Economy.

hook.text: A graphic designer in Bali works for a startup in Berlin. No office, no commute, no full-time contract.

buildup.text: Platforms like Upwork and Fiverr turned freelancing from rare to routine. The gig economy exploded.

discovery.text: By 2023, over a third of US workers did some freelance work. Traditional employment is shrinking.

twist.text: Freedom comes with costs: no benefits, no stability, and the constant hustle for the next gig.

climax.text: The gig economy redefined productivity from hours worked to outcomes delivered.

punchline.text: The office isn't dead. But it's optional now.

quiz.question: What share of US workers did some freelance work by 2023?
